hints.content: Let's find the values of each bar on each graph.

###Graph $1$


[[☃ image 1]]


The graph shows only $45$ Concord grapes were picked, not $50$. This graph does **not** represent the table.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Grapes and the vertical axis labeled Grape Type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line labeled 5, extends to the middle of 0 and 10, Niagara bar line labeled 35, extends to the middle of 30 and 40, Red Globes bar line labeled 30, extends to 30, and Concord bar line labeled 45, extends to the middle of 40 and 50. !

hints.content:
###Graph $2$


[[☃ image 1]]

The graph shows $50$ Thompson grapes were picked, not $45$. This graph does **not** represent the table.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Grapes and the vertical axis labeled Grape Type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line labeled 50, extends to 50, Niagara bar line labeled 30, extends to 30, Red Globes bar line labeled 35, extends to the middle of 30 and 40, and Concord bar line labeled 50, extends to 50. !

hints.content:
###Graph $3$


[[☃ image 1]]

All numbers on the graph match the numbers in the chart. This graph does represent the table!

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Grapes and the vertical axis labeled Grape Type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line labeled 45, extends to the middle of 40 and 50, Niagara bar line labeled 30, extends to 30, Red Globes bar line labeled 35, extends to the middle of 30 and 40, and Concord bar line labeled 50, extends to 50. !

hints.content:
This graph matches the information in the table:


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Grapes and the vertical axis labeled Grape Type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line extends to the middle of 40 and 50, Niagara bar line extends to 30, Red Globes bar line extends to the middle of 30 and 40, and Concord bar line extends to 50. !

question.content:
A grape orchard grows many different types of grapes. Below is a table to show how many grapes were picked on Tuesday.

Grape type |  Number of Grapes
:- | :-: | :-:
Concord | $50$
Red Globes | $35$
Niagara | $30$
Thompson | $45$

**Which bar graph correctly graphs the information in the table?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Grapes and the vertical axis labeled Grape Type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line extends to the middle of 40 and 50, Niagara bar line extends to 30, Red Globes bar line extends to the middle of 30 and 40, and Concord bar line extends to 50.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e6c2da74138e2c998a99b247a5d873e9d63a36dc)

![A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Grapes and the vertical axis labeled Grape Type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line extends to 50, Niagara bar line extends to 30, Red Globes bar line extends to the middle of 30 and 40, and Concord bar line extends to 50.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0cf9c546eed1f34e0cfac5c2de5e75245b9dc1c4)

The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Thompson, Niagara, Red Globes, and Concord. The bar line for each grape type shows the following: Thompson bar line extends to the middle of 0 and 10, Niagara bar line extends to the middle of 30 and 40, Red Globes bar line extends to 30, and Concord bar line extends to the middle of 40 and 50.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a284607cb0c7310027226bf3064fbe69a0608b33)
